content: little octopus stuffie by andy s cozy crochet www facebook com/andyscozycrochet this pattern is for a small handheld octopus that is made all in one piece the eyes are stitched to make it safe for infants and toddlers and it is cute as just a toy on a desk or for little ones to play with it can be worked up in an hour or less supplies worsted weight yarn in any colour a scrap of black yarn for the eyes size 4 00mm g crochet hook yarn needle polyfil or fiberfil for stuffing stitch marker notes *this is made in amigurumi style make sure your gauge is tight enough so stuffing doesn t show through but not so tight that you can t work your hook through use an appropriate hook size to reach the appropriate gauge *the head is worked in joined rounds use a stitch marker to keep track of your first stitch in each row *eyes are stitched on with a yarn needle *you may sell items made from my patterns as long as you credit andy s cozy crochet as the pattern designer do not claim my photos or pattern as your own abbreviations american terminology magic_ring magic_ring sl slip_stitch single_crochet single_crochet half_double_crochet half_double_crochet double_crochet double_crochet increase increase decrease decrease st/sts stitch/stitches the pattern r1 in a magic_ring 6 single_crochet r2 increase in each 12 single_crochet r3 *single_crochet single_crochet increase* around 16 single_crochet r4 *single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet increase* around 20 single_crochet i pause here to weave in my starting end r5 7 single_crochet in each 20 single_crochet r8 *single_crochet single_crochet single_crochet decrease* around 16 single_crochet pause here to stitch your eyes on round 7 ensure your ends are knotted and woven through the inside especially if making it for a small child i stitch 2 vertical lines going over each eye twice how big and how spaced apart you want your eyes is up to you if you opt to use safety eyes you can do so now r9 *single_crochet single_crochet decrease* around 12 single_crochet r10 *single_crochet decrease* around 8 single_crochet sl to join do not tighten the sl keep it loose this is where we start the tentacles don t worry they re all the same and quite simple r10 ended with 8sc and each is the start of a tentacle there will be photos to help explain if you don t need photos here are the written instructions r11 chain 8 in 3rd chain from hook 3 double_crochet in next 2 chs 3 double_crochet in next 2 chs 3 half_double_crochet in next and last chain 2 half_double_crochet sl to next single_crochet from r10 and repeat when last tentacle is made make sure you have 8 sl to the single_crochet that the first tentacle started from not the first sl or chs of tentacle sl and 8 chain
